definition[0]: when a company thinking of buying another looks carefully at its accounts, as it must do by law before the deal can be agreed
example[0]: The acquisition is subject to a due diligence review by the central bank and approval from the government.
definition[1]: when an organization selling investments checks their quality before selling them in order to protect investors
example[1]: Discipline in the due-diligence area often breaks down when times are busy.
